intro: Erodium triangulare f. micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a low-growing herb characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the spring and early summer. The species is noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
